intro: Senecio hyadesii, commonly known as the Hyades' senecio, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, dry conditions. Its foliage is often grayish-green, with hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. Senecio hyadesii produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators.
